title: Guiyang
summary: Guiyang (/ɡweɪˈjæŋ/;[1] simplified Chinese: 贵阳; traditional Chinese: 貴陽; pinyin: Guìyáng; Mandarin pronunciation: [kwêi.jǎŋ]) is the capital of Guizhou province of the People's Republic of China. It is located in the center of the province, situated on the east of the Yunnan–Guizhou Plateau, and on the north bank of the Nanming River, a branch of the Wu River. The city has an elevation of about 1,100 meters (3,600 ft). It has an area of 8,034 square kilometers (3,102 sq mi).[2] At the 2010 census, its population was 4,324,561, out of whom 3,037,159 lived in the seven urban districts.[3]
